pull.title: Pre-28.x branch off version bump and doc updates
pull.body:
* Bump to 28.99 in preparation for the 28.x branching
* Remove current release note fragments. They've been moved to [draft release notes]((https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-devwiki/wiki/28.0-Release-Notes-Draft).) in the wiki.
* Updated bips.md with missing BIPs that were implemented a while ago.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage
For detailed information about the code coverage, see the [test coverage report](https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/30719).
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| ACK | [maflcko](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30719#issuecomment-2312875597), [tdb3](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30719#pullrequestreview-2263953998) |
| Stale ACK | [hebasto](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30719#pullrequestreview-2263736245) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with 👎 to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.

ACK b58869f3bf5a468ef96152d357d0f8bdb7cce07d
Left nits, but resolved them in the [Wiki page](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-devwiki/wiki/28.0-Release-Notes-Draft)

>Bump to 28.99 in preparation for the 28.x branching

This should be post-branching...?

> This should be post-branching...?

I don't think it particularly matters since that step has to be done in the 28.x branch too, in addition to the other version numbers being bumped.

> > This should be post-branching...?
> 
> I don't think it particularly matters since that step has to be done in the 28.x branch too, in addition to the other version numbers being bumped.

During the previous release cycle, it was done just _after_ the branching off.

UPD. I agree that it does not really matter.

> lgtm, should also do doc/release-notes/release-notes-27064.md

Added to the wiki, but still needs to be removed here.

events.message: docs: Remove release 28.0 release notes fragments

events.body:
> lgtm, should also do doc/release-notes/release-notes-27064.md

Good catch, removed it.
